review_content: Old Untappd checkin, July 22, 2019. Brown glass bottle. Subtle malt aroma. Light malt flavor, slightly sweet and floral, clean finish. Solid pilsner.

The aroma is to style with a flowery hop and a sweet malt. The appearance is golden with a decent head. The taste is like the aroma with a slightly soapy aftertaste. The palate is typical for the style. Overall not bad.
Trigo bem selecionado, de reveja leve, e consegui matar a saudade da Patagônia....

Coloração amarela, pouco turva.
Espuma clara e de boa duração
Sabor levemente maltado
Exelente cerveja, depois da aquisição da AmBev não teve grandes mudanças no produto, ótimo custo beneficio se comprado a garrafa de 750ml
Aromat zboze troche chlebka i wlasciwie tyle. Jasne lekkie bez goryczki. Malo sie tu dzieje nawet jak na czeskiego pilsa
Pours a cloudy weak golden with a white head. Corn and circus peanut aromas and flavor. Soft nearly flat mouthfeel.

High formation foam, low density and short duration. Golden bright and translucent. At first, aroma is hoppy, very citric with notes of passion fruit and malted.
On mouth the same notes. Hoppy, citric with passion fruit and malted. The bitterness is medium, short and a dry end.
Aftertaste is a bit more bitter, little bit longer and a malted end.
A very nice beer if in a good price.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

High formation foam, low density and short duration. Golden bright and translucent. At first, aroma is hoppy, very citric with notes of passion fruit and malted. Little bit yeasty at the end too.
On mouth the same notes. Hoppy, citric with passion fruit and malted. The bitterness is medium, short and a dry end.
Aftertaste is a bit more bitter, little bit longer and a malted end.
A very nice beer if in a good price.
When you. buy a case, they plant a tree- They are in partnership with the  National forest foundation    And the beer is very tasty. And I love the bottle

Bottle.  Pours a golden yellow with a decent white head that slowly fades.  Taste is of malt, grain and some hops.  Similar aroma.  Has a medium body with a clean finish.  Easy to drink and enjoyable.

Pours clear, bubbly yellow with a thick though not long-lived eggshell head. Aroma provides crisp raw malt and zesty pomme. Flavor yields crisp malt and sweet, slightly tart pomme. Texture offers fair body and fizz. Heck, drink it for the trees.

Bottle from Total Wine. Pours a crystal clear medium gold color with a tiny white head and poor retention. No lacing. Grainy aroma. Not much pilsner flavor, but it's a very good lager. Clean and crisp and lightly sweet. No bitterness. Maybe a touch of diacetyl? Very repeatable.

Label different from this and 5.4% instead of listed 5.2...also brewed in CA vs Argentina...but the barcode came up with this and the bartender said it was a bud product...which this confirms...very very light smell of bud like malt...taste is low on sweet malt...malty thickness but kinda neutral on flavor...just malty mouthfeel and then in slowly disappears... that's it...no complexity.....had at TLC before a SCAEP meeting at conquest
Slightly better than average macro lager. Was decently full tasting, corn chips, pale malts, a few floral notes.
Old Untappd checkin, July 22, 2019. Brown glass bottle. Subtle malt aroma. Light malt flavor, slightly sweet and floral, clean finish. Solid pilsner.

The aroma is to style with a flowery hop and a sweet malt. The appearance is golden with a decent head. The taste is like the aroma with a slightly soapy aftertaste. The palate is typical for the style. Overall not bad.
Trigo bem selecionado, de reveja leve, e consegui matar a saudade da Patagônia....
Coloração amarela, pouco turva. Espuma clara e de boa duraçã…
Exelente cerveja, depois da aquisição da AmBev não teve grandes mudanças no produto, ótimo custo beneficio se comprado a garrafa de 750ml
Aromat zboze troche chlebka i wlasciwie tyle. Jasne lekkie bez goryczki. Malo sie tu dzieje nawet jak na czeskiego pilsa
Pours a cloudy weak golden with a white head. Corn and circus peanut aromas and flavor. Soft nearly flat mouthfeel.

High formation foam, low density and short duration. Golden bright and translucent. At first, aroma is hoppy, very citric with notes of passion fruit and malted. On mouth the same notes. Hoppy, citric with passion fruit and malted. The bitterness…
High formation foam, low density and short duration. Golden bright and translucent. At first, aroma is hoppy, very citric with notes of passion fruit and malted. Little bit yeasty at the end too.…
When you. buy a case, they plant a tree- They are in partnership with the  National forest foundation    And the beer is very tasty. And I love the bottle

Bottle.  Pours a golden yellow with a decent white head that slowly fades.  Taste is of malt, grain and some hops.  Similar aroma.  Has a medium body with a clean finish.  Easy to drink and enjoyable.

Pours clear, bubbly yellow with a thick though not long-lived eggshell head. Aroma provides crisp raw malt and zesty pomme. Flavor yields crisp malt and sweet, slightly tart pomme. Texture offers fair body and fizz. Heck, drink it for the trees.

Bottle from Total Wine. Pours a crystal clear medium gold color with a tiny white head and poor retention. No lacing. Grainy aroma. Not much pilsner flavor, but it's a very good lager. Clean and crisp and lightly sweet. No bitterness. Maybe a touch of diacetyl?…

Label different from this and 5.4% instead of listed 5.2...also brewed in CA vs Argentina...but the barcode came up with this and the bartender said it was a bud product...which this confirms...very very light smell of bud like malt...taste is low on…
Slightly better than average macro lager. Was decently full tasting, corn chips, pale malts, a few floral notes.
Brewed in US at Fairfield, CA microbrewery.  Cloudy gold color with a thin white head and soft carbonation. The aroma is grain - corn, honey and grass. The taste is sweet. Good.
As a Macro lager this is pretty solid. Creamy mouthfeel. Well done was surprised.

Right at the bottom of the colour chart, this beer pours a clear golden colour with a finger of creamy white head. Not too much to say as there are many beers that are very similar, but let’s try. A crisp, fresh aroma with noble hop qualities, provided by the Saaz hops. The flavour profile is fresh, with clean pale malts and floral qualities, yet it is missing the herbs and spice from the Saaz hops which are far more evident in Stella Artois; which, if you were wondering, is well known for using the very same hops. There is a mild bitterness to the grainy finish, making it a much more refreshing drink in comparison to Stella which is twice the IBU. The mouthfeel is light and smooth, with a medium body and a medium-high carbonation. The head retention was once again faultless with excellent lacing, but let’s continue to emphasise that these beers are fresh from the brewery, anything less would be a massive worry.

Read the full review here:

www.beerwithus1.wordpress.com/2019/06/08/patagonia-brewery
Drank 4 for game 5 Stanley Cup.  Deep gold decent frothy head.  Nose is cardboard and some pale malt.  Tastes of florals, dough, cardboard, pale malt.  Bland little odd aftertaste.
Huge bottle in salta. Clean but tedious. Bland. Like Budweiser. It will do at a pinch.

5/18/19 - Tallahassee, Fl - Publix - Killearn - 12 oz bottle. Sparkling, medium golden, decent bubble action, soft snow white head clings to the edge of the glass. Grainy aroma, hint of fresh lake water. Buttery flavor, some grainy notes, a hint of nuttiness. Crisp mouthfeel. Better than expected.

12 ounce can - $2.49 at Total Wine & More in Kennesaw, Georgia.

Appearance: Pours a clear, golden body with a thin, white head that vanishes nigh instantaneously.

Smell: A little hint of corn syrup with a touch of soggy barley.

Taste: Too sugary in parts, too bland in others. Faint sourish grain, a bit of unctuous herb. Has a rather displeasing finish that just lays on the tongue like a festering dead animal.

Mouthfeel: Thin-bodied. Medium-light carbonation. Oily, insipid mouthfeel.

Overall: It fails at the only thing I can ask of macro brews these days: don't be gross. It's kinda gross. Unpleasant, lingering sweetness with a bad aftertaste.
Clean and refreshing. Nothing special about it but it is far from the worst. Flavor profile is significant yet not punchy. Also every 6 pack you buy they plant trees and I like that.
Maybe just a little bit more bitterness to it than average south american lager.

12oz bottle at home.  Clear gold with a big, foamy white head.  This is a typical export lager - buttered corn, sweet damp malt, horsey, not very crisp.  Soft carb and texture.  Lingering corn finish.  Fine for what it is, not super offensive but meh.

Hey, you buy a case, they plant a tree, so there's exactly one reason to drink this awful non-pilsner, non-Bohemian Bohemian pilsner. Sweet corn, burnt grain, dog hair, and butter. Apparently ABInBev is trying to crack into the lucrative green-friendly premium fake Mexican lager consumer market?

Billed as a bohemian pilsner but make no mistake, this is macro swill. That said, against macro swill it swings for the fenced. You actually do get some grassy hops and real malt off this. But it's not very crisp and lacks the spicy Saaz notes of its namesake. Light and corny, but you could do a lot worse. Thanks Budweiser by way of Argentina.

Poured from 12 oz bottle in pilsner glass. A 1" frothy white head drops slowly with some mild lacing. Color is clear gold with moderate streaming carbonation. Aroma of pilsner malt, cracker, grassy hops. Mouthfeel is light with a somewhat damp finish. Flavor of biscuit, cracker, crusty bread, lemon, grass, a floral note. Overall: good and drinkable, nothing outstanding.
Difficult to rate this one since it is brewed in the US and makes no reference to the Argentine brewery. NIce and easy to drink. Not that simple but neither that crafty. Just chill.

Snappy looking, faceted brown bottle.  Good logo/labels, etc. Beer is very, very pale and clear. Powdery, slightly sweet and slightly floral aroma. Bland, fairly clean though, low bittering.  Light body.  Publix, Bradfordville.
Tap at Sunspot. This was better than I anticipated. Lightly sweet, grassy aroma. Taste is some sweetness and but more hop bite than I was expecting. Not bad, really.

Best before July 21st 2019. Brewed in Fairfield California. 

Pours a clear..look at all those floaties..gold, minimal head of foam, no lacing. 

Smells grainy, corn, somewhat of a hoppy character that reminds me of nothing. 

Taste is kinda grassy, grainy without much of a corny flavour, the hops have a sharp edge to them but they are not all that unpleasant. 

Mouthfeel is okay. 

Doesn't resemble a Pilsner at all in my book. Not worth revisiting.
33.5cl fles. Helder goudgeel kleur, fijne romige witte schuimkraag. De geur van mout en gras. Smaak is zoet, maltose, gras en olieachtig. Medium lichaam, veel koolzuur.
Uma cerveja de muito sabor, refrescante, equilibrada, uma pilsen de nível, muito acima das cervejas comerciais.

Cerveja honesta justa, bem dentro do estilo é melhor que as cervejas de massa. 
Cor dourada clara média formação/duração de espuma. 
Amargor
Moderado pro estilo. Boa cerveja embora tenha um sabor levemente enjoativo.

330ml bottle. Clear, dark orangey, golden colour with average, frothy, half-way lasting, minimally lacing, white head. Minimally bready, spicy, sweet-ish malty aroma, toasty hints of bread crust. Taste is minimally sweet, spicy and bready malty, plain bitter hoppy overtones. Minimally oily texture, slightly creamy palate. Quite OK.

Bottle from Hopt. Aroma is sweet grainy malt with cereal and some caramel. Much lower on hop than I'd hoped for. Rather sweet flavour with a light bitterness. Body is a relatively solid medium. Overall disappointing, not very 'bohemian'.

Garrafa. Coloração dourada translúcida. Espuma de média formação e baixa persistência. Aroma de cereais frescos e  pão. Sabor acompanha o aroma. Final levemente seco. Aftertaste com nuance frutada. Boa drinkability.
Bottle from Saveur Biere. Clear golden with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty and corn. Flavor is medium sweet and light bitter. Sweet and light bitter finish. 031218

Brazilian version, all malt. Bottle in itaim bibi SP, 8 R$. Golden color, short white head, fading. Mild malty flavor with some grass in the finish. Taste sugary with a mild bitterness, relatively well bodied, oily texture, starchy off-flavor
A combinação de maltes selecionados e lúpulos patagônicos cria uma cerveja com um grande corpo e amargor equilibrado.

Bottle 33cl. @home in a shaker. Clear medium golden, average frothy white head, dissipates slowly, light lacing; aroma malts, grain, light grass, touch of caramel; taste medium sweet and light bitter, malty, grainy, light grass; medium body, texture is oily, soft carbonation; decent lager
Cerveja de cor dourada brilhante, boa formação de espuma de baixa persistência, aroma suave e amargor bem leve.
Aroma bem suave. Maltado. Aparência perfeita. Dourada, límpida, efervescente e com um belo creme denso. No sabor bastante malte e um que de ester que achei mal inserido. Corpo leve. Desce fácil.
La cerveza está bien, aunque tiene algunos errores como diacetilo presente... Una de las mejores cervezas de Quilmes. Pero lejos de una buena Pilsener. Muy lejos.

740ml bottle. Pours golden yellow colour. Medium size white head. Bit malty and grassy aroma. Malty, bit grassy taste. Bitter finish. Carbonation is medium. Light bodied, well balanced piksener. Quite drinkable.
Se presenta muy limpia en los perfiles de aroma y sabor. Buen cuerpo, considerando el estilo. Bien hecha.

Clear golden color with an average white head. Medium body, soft carbonation, fair lacing. Aroma of metal, dust, chalk, minerals, grains, straw. Grainy and slightly sweet taste of bread, malts, mild lemon, straw, grass, flowers. Slightly bitter aftertaste. Fair pilsener.

Bottle. Pours a clear golden body with a small white head. Faint aromas of bready malts are present in the nose. The taste has a light to moderate amount of bitterness along with notes of bready malts. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. This beer isn’t very flavorful, but is easy to drink and pairs well with food.
Bottle at home, brought from Argentina. Clear gold, minimal disappearing white head. Metallic, cereal, simple malts and hoppy. Sweet maltiness, easy body, cereal.

Bottle, 0.33l, shared with Saska. Clear deep golden color, thin quickly diminishing white head and average sparkling appearance. Aroma is grainy, grassy, dusty and mild floral. Taste starts medium sweet grainy and chalky, following is mild fruity and grassy, while finish is medium bitter. Light body, slick texture and average carbonation in palate. Not bad, but without any notable surplus...

Clear golden color with white head. Grainy aroma. Taste of grains, cereal and a bit spicy. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a clear golden color, topped with a medium white head. Grassy nose with some chalk and dust. Mild bitetry feel with sweet backbone. A bit metallic. Mild taste. Typical lager feel, nothing special. Light and drinkable, that’s it.
Butelka 0,33l na lotnisku w Buenos Aires. Kolor złoty, ładny,klarowny, piana drobna osiada na szkle. Aromat słodowy w smaku lekkie cytrusy, goryczka w normie, przyjemne na podniebieniu, dobre piwo.
Bottle from Asuncion Gas Station. Bold gold body with fast-receding head. Nose is skunky, wheat. Taste is hops, cereal, straw, some citrus notes. Some fruits in the finish. Pretty basic stuff.

Muy buena, de lo mejor industrial que hay por Argentina........
..... precio/calidad: muy bien

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Perfeito essa cerveja, boa para tomar com petiscos de bar e com carnes vermelhas

drunk from the bottle while in Argentinian Patagonia, solid beer especially compared to the other swill produced in Latin America. Good smooth taste, some hops a little bit of malt. Very drinkable pilsener

Pours pale yellow with thin white head. Light malty aroma, no hops. Taste is light malty and a slight bitter finish. Light body, average carbonation. Better than most macros, but far from a bohemian pilsner.

The beer has a simple pilsener look. The color is golden, a little bit darker than most times. The beer is crystal clear and doesn’t show a lot of gassy action. A normal layer of rough foam forms, only to disappear shotgun seconds to leave nothing. The smell is nice. It is quite fresh and sweet. There are some sweet malty aroma’s and some slightly sour and bitter hip aroma’s. This beer is more aromatic than most simple pilsners. The taste is also quite nice. The beer is quite sweet. There is a sweet malty flavor accompanied by a sweet alcohol flavor. There is a nice hoppy bitterness to balance this out. The beer is more fruits and hoppy than most pilsners. The palate is quite simple. It has a little watery sensation. I miss some gas.

Dorado con transparencia, espuma baja sin retención. Malta maltoso moderado bajo, DMS, skunky, ligero diacetilo, lúpulo imperceptible. En boca malta maltoso moderado, diacetilo, lúpulo herbal bajo, lúpulo de amargor bajo. Final maltoso frescocon ligero amargor sin astringencia, cuerpo medio-bajo, carbonatación regular.

I bought this beer in Lima, Miraflores. I was disappointing with this brewery. I love the pils and in my point of view, it is not a pils. If I compare with la voisine from "les trois dames" this beer is more like a plain lager but it is better than the amber ale. The color is yellow gold, thin foam and average carbonation. The taste is a bit malty, some sweetness but few hop, so-so.

740ml bottle my wife brought back from Argentina 

Pours clear golden with a medium sized white head, some lacing. Aroma of straw, grains, honey and citrus. Taste is grainy, grassy, straw with a mild lemon bitterness 

Decent
